definition: to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
to get into a habit/to become addicted
erhua variant of 癮頭|瘾头[yin3 tou2]

sentences.english: By some freak I was overpaid this month.
And, back before May 7th, Sheila also liked to smoke. A lot.
sentences.chinese: 而且在5月7号前，Sheila也抽烟，瘾还很大。

sentences.english: Picking up the fresh strawberries was our happy time. We were orchardists.
sentences.chinese: 采摘新鲜草莓让小朋友们过足了一把果农瘾。

sentences.english: In fact, some scientists even see love as a sort of addiction.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，有些科学家甚至把爱情看作一种“瘾”。

sentences.english: So many of us are addicted to the pulse.
sentences.chinese: 我们很多人都有脉动瘾。

sentences.english: Internet video junkies will be happy to know that Mux is totally free of charge.
sentences.chinese: 网际网路视讯瘾会乐于知道多工器是完全免费的。

sentences.english: Also many like to call it an “addiction”.
sentences.chinese: 同时很多人会把它看做是一种“瘾”。

sentences.english: The environmental impact is only one cost of our oil addiction.
sentences.chinese: 环境污染只是我们石油瘾的代价之一。

sentences.english: Researchers recruited 39 students who are self-professed snack food junkies.
sentences.chinese: 研究员招募了39个自称爱零食爱上了瘾的学生。

sentences.english: Its state-run media thundered that America needed to its addiction to debt.
sentences.chinese: 其央媒大肆宣扬说美国需要控制下其负债的瘾。

sentences.english: Eventually I broke the addiction to credit cards, instead relying on loans from family members.
sentences.chinese: 最终我戒掉了用信用卡的瘾，改成向家人“贷款”。

sentences.english: It's also the reason why many people love eating spicy hot pot, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 许多人从此失足，对麻辣火锅吃上了瘾。

definition: to get into a habit/to become addicted
to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
a treat for the eyes/the rare chance of seeing sth beautiful
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
